articles.author: Jacklin Kwan
articles.title: Fossils locked away for 1.75 billion years hold clues about key moment in Earth's history - Livescience.com
articles.description: Fossils from Australia provide the first direct evidence that photosynthesis was happening at least 1.75 billion years ago.
articles.content:
The earliest direct evidence of photosynthesis has been discovered in fossils dating back to 1.75 billion years ago.
Scientists collected fossils from Australia, Canada and the Democratic Republic o… [+3592 chars]
